item.title: My New Post
item.description: Some lovely python print("hello world") ## hello world Python ‘if/else’ statements allow you to categorize a string in a variety of ways. Below, given the string “Failure is a bruise, not a tatoo” python can evaluate whether or not the character meets the criteria for each statement. If it meets the criteria, python will go to the next indented statement (print out a statement about the string), and if not it will move down to the next line to evaluate if the string meets those characteristics, and so on.
